lg.l:
SAynt Saynt
Martyne was borne in þe londe of Sabarie
wel &yogh;onge he was no&rrot;y&slong;&slong;et i&combmacr; in þe londe of Papie
A heghe kny&yogh;t his may&slong;t&ercurl; mayster was &et; al mai&slong;ter&hidot; of þe furde

in co&slong;ta&combmacr;tynes Costantynes hou&slong;e þe
em&pbardes;our&combhook; emperoure &et; al his o&slong;t he s&slong;tured

to kirke
quen&combhook; quene he nas xii &yogh;e&rrot; olde well &slong;tilly he wende
&et; behette our&combhook; oure londe cristen to be que&combmacr; quen he þt þat tyme sende
the emperour bede in al his lond þat iche olde knyȝt
þat his son&combhook; shulde in bataill for· his fad&combhook; fiȝht
so þt &slong;aint Ma&rrot;tyne· was not bote of fiftene ȝer&combhook; olde
quen&combhook; ⁁he þe armes of his fade&rrot;· in bataile beur&combhook; bere shulde
Albynt&combhook; as þis childe rode bi þe way allone
A po&rrot;e mo&combmacr; man he mette al nakid &et; so&rrot; fo&rrot;· colde g&rrot;one

Saynt martyn&combhook; Martyne
ab&rrot;aidid abraidid out his sworde as we finde i&combmacr; in bokeThe "a" in "abraidid" has been added in a later hand in black ink, the same hand responsible for notations in the right margin.
as he bihelde some after·wa&rrot;de to heue&combmacr; heuen vp on heghe
wt wit his halue ma&combmacr;tel mantel hillid our&combhook; oure lo&rrot;de c&rrot;i&slong;t Crist he seghe
lo he &slong;eide to is aungelles þis shal not me be reyuyde reuyde

ma&rrot;tyn&combhook; Martyne
þt þat is heþene ȝit herewt herewit me has weyuyde weuyde
A winter a&slong;e þis child rod &punctelev; bi þe we&ydot;e al one
A Mi&slong;ei&slong;e miseise man he mette naked &punctelev; &slong;o&rrot;e &slong;ike and grone
Seint Mart&ydot;n d&rrot;ovȝ out is &slong;werd &punctelev; a&slong;e we findeth in þe boke
And carf is Mantel mantel half ato &punctelev; and þe pouere Manne manne it bitok
¶Sone afturward a&slong;e he biheold &punctelev; toward heouene an heiȝh
with is halue Mantel mantel iheled &punctelev; o&rrot;e louerd cri&slong;t Crist he &slong;eiȝh
lo he &slong;eide to is Aungles aungles &punctelev; þis ne wo&rrot;th me nouȝht bireued
Martin þat is heþene ȝu&ydot;t &punctelev; herewith me hath biweued
Þo Martin þis iherde &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerd he &slong;aiȝh þere
Glad ne bliþe nolde he beo &punctelev; are he ic&combtildevert;&slong;tned icristned were
¶Eiȝhtetene ȝer he was old &punctelev; þo he icri&slong;tned wa&slong;
Þat he hadde &slong;o longue abide &punctelev; ofte he &slong;eide alas
Ake al þe to ȝer þareafturward &punctelev; into batailes he wende
Fo&rrot; is fader wide aboute &punctelev; a&slong;e þe Aumpero&rrot; him &slong;ende
hit bifel of a gret bataile &punctelev; þat þe Aumpero&rrot; hadde inome
he het alle is kn&ydot;ȝhte&slong; in is lond &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden to him come
he het Mart&ydot;n with heom wende &punctelev; and Armure armure with him takeThe "h" in "het" looks like it was originally "ie". See line 11.
Certe&slong; &slong;ire Martin &slong;eide þine Arme&slong; armes ich habbe fo&rrot;&slong;ake
¶Ich am Ie&slong;u cri&slong;tes Cristes kn&ydot;ȝht &punctelev; and &slong;o ich habbe ibeo longue
And none oþure Arme&slong; armes bote his &punctelev; i nelle vnderfongue
Ei couward &slong;eide þe Aumperour &punctelev; nouþe þou &slong;pare&slong;t fo&rrot; fere
Fo&rrot;to fiȝhte with þine felawe&slong; &punctelev; a&slong;e þi riȝte were
Sire &slong;eide Martin þo &punctelev; þe &slong;oþe þou &slong;chalt i&slong;e
Of þine Arme&slong; armes ne kepe i nouȝht &punctelev; ake þe fur&slong;te ichulle beo
Al one bifo&rrot;e al þi folk &punctelev; naked to þe bataile
Mine louerde&slong; miȝhte þou &slong;chalt i&slong;eo &punctelev; fo&rrot; he me nele nouȝt faile
¶Þo þat ferd alȝare wa&slong; &punctelev; seint Martin wende anon
Vnarmed with is &slong;werd ad&rrot;awe &punctelev; among alle is fon
Þo he among hem wa&slong; icome &punctelev; þare na&slong; of hem nouȝht on
Þat miȝhte ani mo&rrot;e hebbe up is hond &punctelev; þane it were a &slong;ton
hu&ydot; ȝolden him þe mai&slong;trie anon &punctelev; bote þat he let hem aliue
Seint Martin clepede is felawe&slong; &punctelev; and het hem hom wel bliue
Are ȝe alle it hadden þarto ib&rrot;ouȝht &punctelev; longue ȝe mo&slong;ten fiȝhte
¶Nov þou ha&slong;t alle þine fon iwonne &punctelev; þonke god God and nouȝht me
And haue guod da&ydot; fo&rrot; i nelle &punctelev; no lengo&rrot;e &slong;erui þe
he nam is leue and wende fo&rrot;th &punctelev; he nolde no leng abide
To þe holie bi&slong;chop h&ydot;llari Hyllari &punctelev; þat wonede þarebi&slong;ide
Of him he wa&slong; imaud acolite &punctelev; and dude al bi is rede
Ore louerd cam to him a niȝht &punctelev; and þeo&slong; wo&rrot;de&slong; to him &slong;eide
¶Ich hote þe Martin þat þou go &punctelev; wel ofte to þine kunne
And &slong;pec with hem ȝif þov miȝht &punctelev; b&rrot;ingue hem out of &slong;unne
Þei þat hu&ydot; heþene beon &punctelev; ne let heom nouȝht þarefo&rrot;e
Fo&rrot; ech guod man schal Anouri anouri þat kun &punctelev; þat he wa&slong; of ibo&rrot;e
Ake gret anu&ydot; þov &slong;chalt habbe &punctelev; þe ȝwile þou ge&slong;t aboute
Þe ȝw&ydot;le þou mine grace ha&slong;t &punctelev; þe þarf nowiȝht doute

Þis guode Man man a&slong;e o&rrot;e louerd him het &punctelev; toward i&slong; kun wendeHorstmann believes that "het" was originally "hiet" (see lines 11 and 31). The downward loop of the "h" is very straight and there is a trace of an "i" diacritic over it.
Strongue outlawe&slong; bi þe wei he mette &punctelev; heo&rrot;e bouwe&slong; &slong;one hu&ydot; bende
Þis guode man hu&ydot; nomen &punctelev; and maden him mani a wounde
Fo&rrot;th hu&ydot; ladden him fo&rrot;to sle &punctelev; is hondene fa&slong;te ibounde
Þe outlawe&slong; axede him ȝif he were &punctelev; &slong;o &slong;o&rrot;e ad&rrot;ad euere
Nai certes quath þis holie man &punctelev; þat nas ich neuere
¶Ore louerdes hel⁁p was euere neiȝh &punctelev; þe manne þat was in care
So muche i&slong; þarto min hope &punctelev; þat ine rechche hou ich fare

Of Ih&combcurl;u Ihesu
cri&slong;t Crist he tolde so &punctelev; with heom þat him nome
Þat hu&ydot; ful &slong;one leten him go &punctelev; and cri&slong;tine fo&rrot; him bicome
A&slong;e þis guode Man man eode fo&rrot;th al one &punctelev; þe deuel aȝein him cam
In faire manere he axede him &punctelev; ȝwodere þene wei he nam
Þis guode Man man &slong;eide ichulle go &punctelev; a&slong;e mi louerd wole lede me
Ȝwodere þou go þe oþur &slong;eide &punctelev; þe deuel wole aȝein þe beo
¶Ȝe &slong;eide þis guode Man man &punctelev; þou mo&slong;t wel al&slong;o
Fo&rrot; ȝwane o&rrot;e louerd is min help &punctelev; ine rechche ȝwat oþure do
Þis guode Man man eode among is freond &punctelev; is moder cri&slong;tine he made
his fader nolde cri&slong;tine be &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat hu&ydot; him bede
Seint Martin fond a ȝong man ded &punctelev; þat swiþe wel with him wa&slong;
Þat bilefde on o&rrot;e louerd fo&rrot; him &punctelev; ake icri&slong;tned nouȝt he nas
¶Gret deol made þis holie man &punctelev; þat he nadde ibe icri&slong;tned er
To is buriele&slong; he eode and bad fo&rrot; him &punctelev; and weop wel mani a ter
Þe dede Man man bigan anon &punctelev; fram deþe ari&slong;e to liue
Martin he &slong;eide ihered beo þou &punctelev; and o&rrot;e louerde&slong; wounde&slong; fiue
Mi &slong;oule wa&slong; to helle ilad &punctelev; a&slong;e alle beoth of oure ku&ydot;nde
Ake twe&ydot;e Aungles aungles þo&rrot;uȝ godes Godes grace &punctelev; hadden me in mu&ydot;nde
And &slong;eiden o&rrot;e louerd þat ich hadde &punctelev; ouwer de&slong;ciple ibeo
Þarefo&rrot;e o&rrot;e louerd me dude ari&slong;e &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe honour of þe
And dude mi &slong;oule to mi bodi &punctelev; fo&rrot; þi loue hider b&rrot;ingue
Cri&slong;tinedom par charite &punctelev; ich e&slong;che bifo&rrot;e alle þingue
Þat folk nam &slong;ethþe &slong;eint Martin &punctelev; fo&rrot; he wa&slong; &slong;o guod
And maden him bi&slong;chop of turo&ydot;ne Turoyne &punctelev; muche aȝein is mod
To mile withoute þe cite &punctelev; an Abbe&ydot;e abbeye he liet arere
Four &slong;co&rrot;e Moneke&slong; monekes of guode liue &punctelev; him&slong;ulf he dude þere
with heom he wonede al in pa&ydot;s &punctelev; a&slong;e he heo&rrot;e &slong;oueren were
he ne wende nouȝht out bote ȝwane it neod wa&slong; &punctelev; þat folk fo&rrot;to lere
¶So holi lif &slong;eint Martin ladde &punctelev; þat he hadde to is he&slong;te
A &slong;trong wind blevȝ a fu&ydot;&rrot; &punctelev; þat to &slong;eint Martine&slong; hou&slong;e it wende
And are þis guode man it onderȝete &punctelev; ibarnd wa&slong; þat on ende
Seint Mart&ydot;n hiet a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; þat fu&ydot;&rrot; aȝein wiende
Fo&rrot; is he&slong;te þat fu&ydot;r flevȝ &punctelev; anon aȝein þe w&ydot;nde
To þe &slong;tude þare it cam fram &punctelev; and ne bilefde no wiȝht bihinde

And dude aȝein þe ku&ydot;nde of fu&ydot;&rrot;e &punctelev; aȝein þe w&ydot;nde to fleThe words "fuyr" and "fle" look smeared, but almost as if some letters were written over erasures. This page has numerous examples of the phenomenon. Most likely this was caused by imperfections in the parchment, but a few might be actual erasures.
Þare wa&slong; i&slong;ene þat fu&ydot;&rrot; ne miȝhte &punctelev; aȝein is he&slong;te be
A&slong;e ȝe mouwen bi a fair miracle &punctelev; of him nouþe i&slong;eo
On a dai a&slong;e he &slong;tod under a treo &punctelev; to p&rrot;echi gode&slong; Godes lawe
Þe luþere men þat þarebi &slong;toden &punctelev; þouȝhten him b&rrot;ingue of dawe
hu&ydot; gunne &slong;awie þat treo ato &punctelev; toward þis holie Manne manne
Þat it &slong;cholde ouerfalle him &punctelev; fo&rrot; þare nadde he freond nanne
Þo&rrot;uȝ no&ydot;&slong;e of þe crakeȝingue &punctelev; þe guode man iheo&rrot;de
Þat þut treo fel touward him &punctelev; aȝein wel &slong;one he it cherde
¶he het þat treo a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; opward aȝein tu&ydot;&rrot;ne
Þat treo aro&slong; upriȝht inouȝh &punctelev; fo&rrot; it nolde is he&slong;te werne
And ouerful[MS. ouerfalle] in þat oþur &slong;ide &punctelev; anie manie of is fon
hu&ydot; þat leoueden lieten heom &slong;one &punctelev; cri&slong;tni euerechon
Þe wo&rrot;m dude is he&slong;te al&slong;o &punctelev; fo&rrot; a&slong;e he cam bi a watere&slong; b&rrot;imme
A lodlich Nadd&rrot;e naddre he i&slong;aiȝh &punctelev; &slong;tifliche aȝein him come &slong;w&ydot;mme
Ich hote þe &slong;eide þis holie Man man &punctelev; þat þov aȝeinward wende
At Ant þat þou neuereft here ne come &punctelev; ne nouȝwere in þis ende
Þis wo&rrot;m turnede aȝen anon &punctelev; a&slong;e þis holie Man man him het
And &slong;wam into an oþur lond &punctelev; and þulke contreiȝe furlet
he saiȝh douedoppene fi&slong;ches cachche &punctelev; and &slong;wolewen heom in anon
Alas &slong;eide þis guode man &punctelev; þis is þe feonde&slong; manere
Gultle&slong;&slong;e þingus and vnwarre &punctelev; to cachchen a&slong;e hu&ydot; doth here
So farez þe deuel awa&ydot;tez euere &punctelev; fo&rrot;to he is p&rrot;eiȝe i&slong;eo
he het þe foule&slong; a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; echone þanne&slong; teo
And þat hu&ydot; &slong;cholden into wilderne&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; out of þat watere fleo
Þat hu&ydot; neueref neuereft þare ne comen &punctelev; gultle&slong;e þingue&slong; to take
Þis foule&slong; anon with þis wo&rrot;d &punctelev; awei hu&ydot; gonne &slong;chake
¶be&slong;te&slong; duden al&slong;o is he&slong;te &punctelev; fo&rrot; a&slong;e he wende aboute
Aftur ane hare he &slong;aiȝh v&rrot;ne &punctelev; grehounde&slong; a gret route
Alas he &slong;eide þis &slong;eli be&slong;t &punctelev; þat noþing ne doth amis
Þis foule hounde&slong; it wollez tod&rrot;awe &punctelev; gultle&slong; a&slong;e it is
he het þe grehounde&slong; abide anon &punctelev; and ne do þat be&slong;t no wo
hu&ydot; at&slong;tunten anon and eoden aȝein &punctelev; and lieten þat be&slong;t fo&rrot;th go
¶On a t&ydot;me kene hounde&slong; comen &punctelev; aboute one of is manne
he ne miȝhte him wite &slong;o kene hu&ydot; were &punctelev; ne help nadde he nanne
Ich hote eov he &slong;eide a gode&slong; Godes name &punctelev; and on &slong;eint Martine&slong; al&slong;o
Þat ȝe me laten apais wende &punctelev; Min min erinde fo&rrot;to do
Þe hounde&slong; anon with þat wo&rrot;d &punctelev; bigonne to &slong;tonde &slong;tille
And wenden euerech in is we&ydot; &punctelev; to do &slong;eint Martine&slong; wille
¶A kov al&slong;o þat was gidi &punctelev; aboute o&rrot;n in þe londe
Þat fale Men men &slong;lov and be&slong;tes al&slong;o &punctelev; ȝware heo fond anie &slong;tonde
hire ne miȝhte noþing at&slong;tonde aȝein &punctelev; &slong;o &slong;trong þat foule þing was
Aȝein &slong;eint Martin heo cam eo&rrot;ne &punctelev; ase o&rrot;e louerd ȝaf þat cas
So&rrot;e weren is Men men ad&rrot;adde &punctelev; þis guode Man man hire het anon
A gode&slong; Godes name &slong;tonde &slong;tille &punctelev; and ane nane fot fo&rrot;þere gon
Þat be&slong;t þei it gidi were &punctelev; anon it gan abide
Seint Martin þene deuel i&slong;aiȝ &punctelev; opon hire rugge ride
¶Þov luþere þing ȝwat do&slong;tþov þer &punctelev; fo&rrot; euere þou do&slong;t to quede
Ȝw&ydot; trauaile&slong;t þou þat &slong;elie be&slong;t &punctelev; þat ne loueth no mi&slong;dede
Aco&rrot;&slong;ede þing þou wend awei &punctelev; ne cum neiȝh hire nonmo&rrot;e
Þe deuel wende awei anon &punctelev; ȝeollinde &slong;u&ydot;þe &slong;o&rrot;e
he mo&slong;te nede is he&slong;te do &punctelev; a&slong;e wel a&slong;e þe kov
Þo heo of him deliured was &punctelev; a&slong;e ȝe ihereth hov
Mildeliche heo eode to seint Mart&ydot;n &punctelev; to i&slong; fet heo feol akneo anon
And &slong;chok hire heued to þonki him &punctelev; he nolde fram him gon
¶Seint Martin hire het ari&slong;en up &punctelev; and to ire felawes wende
heo lottede on him and eode fo&rrot;th &punctelev; hom to ire owene ende
Seint Martin wa&slong; apo&slong;tlene pier &punctelev; fo&rrot; þe holie go&slong;t aliȝhte
In him a&slong;e in þe Apo&slong;tles &punctelev; in fourme of fu&ydot;r wel b&rrot;iȝhte
A dai a&slong;e þis guode Man man &slong;at &punctelev; allone in is celle
his p&rrot;iue Men men abiden him þareoute &punctelev; and heo&rrot;den him loude telle
Al&slong;o a&slong;e þei it wummen were &punctelev; hu&ydot; heo&rrot;den with him &slong;peke
Þareof hem þouȝhte wonder gret &punctelev; ne do&rrot;&slong;ten hu&ydot; nouȝt in b&rrot;eke
¶Sethþe þo þe guode man cam out &punctelev; hu&ydot; fullen adoun akneo
And axeden ȝwat þe &slong;peche were &punctelev; þat with him hadde ibeo
Þe guode man &slong;eide ich ma&ydot; eou telle &punctelev; fo&rrot; ȝe me beoz p&rrot;iue
It wa&slong; o&rrot;e lauedi and &slong;eint Anneis &punctelev; þat þareinne weren with me
Of þe Io&ydot;e ioye of heouene hu&ydot; &slong;peken &punctelev; and ofte hu&ydot; doth &slong;o
Seint peter Peter ·and seint powel Powel &punctelev; to me comiez ofte al&slong;o

Seint Martin at · para&ydot; Paris · &punctelev; mette ane Mu&slong;el musel bi casThe scribe must have hesitated upon reading "paray" in his exemplar but neglected to find a replacement for this nonsensical word. Horstmann notes that other manuscripts contain "Paris".
he cu&slong;te him and anon afturward &punctelev; þe Mu&slong;el musel al hol was
¶Men ne &slong;eiȝe him neuere wroth &punctelev; ne liȝe noþemo
And ȝwat&slong;oeuere is Men men duden &punctelev; he wolde euere bi on go
In wel pouere wede a da&ydot; &punctelev; he rod out on ane A&slong;&slong;e asse
heiȝe Men mean he mette bi þe weie &punctelev; þat tolden of him þe la&slong;&slong;e
And o&rrot;nen abach and felden hem adoun. &punctelev; hu&ydot; weren with him ful wroþe
hu&ydot; &slong;turten up and nomen þis holie Man man &punctelev; and beoten him ful &slong;o&rrot;e
Euere he wa&slong; &slong;tille and ne &slong;pak no wo&rrot;d &punctelev; fo&rrot; þi hu&ydot; beoten him þe mo&rrot;e

¶Þo hu&ydot; him hadden &slong;o ibete &punctelev; hu&ydot; bilefden
him atþen ende
ligginde þare and wo&rrot;þen on heo&rrot;e ho&rrot;&slong; &punctelev; fo&rrot;th heo&rrot;e wei to wende
Ake heo&rrot;e ho&rrot;&slong; nolden gon of þe &slong;tude &punctelev; fo&rrot; al þat hu&ydot; don miȝten
And criden merci þis guode Man man &punctelev; þat hu&ydot; him hadden mi&slong;do
heo&rrot;e ho&rrot;&slong; hem bere fo&rrot;th anon &punctelev; þo hu&ydot; token on &slong;o
And in an hous þe ȝwile it barnde &punctelev; he slep witoute harm
his cloþe&slong; furbarnden alto cole &punctelev; he ne fielde it noþing warm
¶At a gret fe&slong;te a&slong;e he &slong;cholde &punctelev; þe heiȝe ma&slong;&slong;e &slong;ingue
To churche he wende with is men &punctelev; men gunne aȝein him ringue
Seint Martin bote anne Cu&ydot;&rrot;tel cuyrtel &punctelev; on him&slong;ulf þo nadde
To þe pouere Manne manne he hine ȝaf &punctelev; in an hous þare he him ladde
¶he ne bilefde on him no cloth of wolle &punctelev; bote is Cope cope alone
Þe ma&slong;&slong;e ne miȝhte he bigu&ydot;nne nouȝht &punctelev; þat folk made þarof mone
Ȝw&ydot; neltþou &slong;eide þe Ercedekne &punctelev; þine ma&slong;&slong;e bigu&ydot;nne
Fo&rrot; þou mo&slong;t er ane pouere Manne manne &punctelev; &slong;um cloth to him iwinne

Nov is þis &slong;eide þe Ercedekne &punctelev; gret anu&ydot; with þeThe word "þis" is clearly readable but somewhat rubbed; most likely this was a deliberate erasure. Horstmann notes that other manuscripts read "hit".
Fo&rrot; I ne seo no pouere Man man &punctelev; nouȝwere aboute þe be
No &slong;eide þis holie man &punctelev; it nele faillie þe nouȝht
Al redi þou finde&slong;t a pouere Man man &punctelev; habbe þou þat cloth ib⁁rouȝth
¶Þe Ercedekne in grete wrathþe &punctelev; eode into chepingue
A lodlich cloth he bouȝhte fo&rrot; fif panes &punctelev; to þe bi&slong;chope he gan it b&rrot;ingue
Þe bi&slong;chop eode into þe ve&slong;tiarie &punctelev; is Cope cope he gan of &slong;trepe
he nadde under is ve&slong;timenz &punctelev; to habbe on bote ⁁þis Iu&ydot;pe iuype
Vnneþe it heolede is derne lime&slong; &punctelev; and nouȝht folliche is elbouwes
Fo&rrot; is bare Arme&slong; armes atþe ma&slong;&slong;e &punctelev; þis guode man hadde gret houwe
Fo&rrot; þe ue&slong;timenz wide weren &punctelev; and is Arme&slong; armes &slong;male and lene
la&slong;te is Arme&slong; armes nakede weren i&slong;eiȝe &punctelev; he ne do&rrot;&slong;te hebbe op is hond ene
¶Ake þo he nedlingus at þe &slong;acrement &punctelev; is hondene hebbe up &slong;cholde
An Aungel aungel &slong;chrudde is nakede arme&slong; &punctelev; with tweie sleuene of golde
Þe ercedekne cride and bihiet &punctelev; þat neuereeft mi&slong;don him he nolde
Þe deuel hadde to þis holie man &punctelev; gret onde withalle
he cam in a time him to bitra&ydot;e &punctelev; in riche cloþus of palle
with ho&slong;en and schon of b&rrot;iȝte golde &punctelev; sw&ydot;þe fair he was of face
Martin he &slong;eide wel þe beo &punctelev; ifounde þou ha&slong;t mine grace
Ich am þilke þat þou &slong;erue&slong;t wel &punctelev; ichulle me &slong;chewi to þe
Þov mo&slong;t &slong;one chaungi þi lif &punctelev; and bitime come to me
¶Þi&slong; guode Man man &slong;at in gret þouȝht &punctelev; no wo&rrot;d he ne &slong;ede
Mart&ydot;n he &slong;eide ich am þi freond &punctelev; ȝwarof ha&slong;tþou d&rrot;ede
Ȝwane þin owene god God &slong;pekez with þe &punctelev; here mouth with mouþe
Euere þou ha&slong;t of guode bileue ibeo &punctelev; ne lat it nouȝt faili þe nouþe
Fo&rrot; ich ble&slong;&slong;i alle þat on me bileuez &punctelev; þei hu&ydot; me nouȝht ne &slong;eo
And er þis þei þov ne &slong;eiȝe me nouȝht &punctelev; in þulke ble&slong;&slong;ingue þou wolde&slong;t be
¶I nu&slong;te neuere quath þis guode man &punctelev; þat mi louerd euere &slong;ede
Þat he wolde on v&rrot;þe come &punctelev; in &slong;wuche riche kingene wede
And bote ich mouwe of mine louerdes wounde&slong; &punctelev; on þe &slong;igne ise
Oþur of is cro&ydot;z i nelle ileue &punctelev; þat þou mi louerd be
Þe foule þing wende awe&ydot; &punctelev; and wa&slong; ad&rrot;ad of ane boule
Þe &slong;tude þareAftur þareaftur swiþe longue &punctelev; &slong;tonk of him riȝht foule
¶Þis guode Man man &slong;eide his endeda&ydot; &punctelev; him wa&slong; &slong;w&ydot;þe wel come
his de&slong;ciples weopen so&rrot;e &punctelev; and gret deol to heom nome
Leoue fader hu&ydot; &slong;eiden ȝwat &slong;chulle we do &punctelev; þat þov us wolt fo&rrot;&slong;ake
Vs faderles withoute confo&rrot;t &punctelev; ȝwam wolt þu bitake
Nov wollez wilde wolue&slong; come &punctelev; and alle þine schep a&slong;pille
Ich mot nede &slong;eide þis guode man &punctelev; don mine louerdes wille

Of A&slong;kene askene and of is here⁁·&dblsol;··&dblsol;·he made
⁁ he made &punctelev; a bed at is endeda&ydot;The encoding of the symbol .\\. is approximate.
And þaron feble aȝen is deþe &punctelev; op&rrot;iȝht adoun him&slong;ulue he la&ydot;
And toward heouene lokede a&ydot; &punctelev; &slong;o longue þat it na&slong; non ende
his Men men þouȝhten it dude him harm &punctelev; and wolden him helpe to wende
¶Abideth &slong;eide þis holie man &punctelev; ȝw&ydot; wolle ȝe don &slong;o
latez me ane ȝw&ydot;le biholde þe &slong;tude &punctelev; þat mi &slong;oule &slong;chal to
Þo i&slong;aiȝh he þene deuel aftur is &slong;oule &punctelev; &slong;tonde þare with is feren
Awe&ydot; he &slong;eide þou luþere be&slong;t &punctelev; þou na&slong;t nouȝt to don here
